summary: The Youth Sports Facilities Act of 2024 aims to amend the Public Works and Economic Development Act of 1965 to expand eligibility for grants to include youth sports facilities. The bill focuses on improving access to recreational spaces to combat sedentary lifestyles and obesity, particularly in rural and underserved communities. It prioritizes facilities serving children from low-income families and communities facing opioid crises or community violence. The bill also seeks to stimulate economic development and job creation through youth sports and related businesses.
